children.subject: I'd say you have your plate full as-is.

I would say no - both of those are already very time-consuming classes, and basically any 3 technicals a semester is kind of a full load even without recruiting in my experience.

But then again you may be better at this stuff than I am so you could also think about your past experience - if you've taken 3 technicals a semester before and found you had extra time, then maybe you can do it, if you've taken 2 a semester before and it was already hard then probably not - it's likely that 16b and 61c together will be at least as hard as any other pair of CS classes you've taken.

If you do decide to take an extra class some light CS classes I've taken are CS C100 (Data 100) and CS 188. There's also posts on the Berkeley subreddit about easy CS classes. If you're L&S CS you could maybe look into other technical electives that are also light - lots of not very technical courses (Linguistics 100 for example) count as technical electives, or take a breadth course. (But again if I had your schedule plus recruiting I would just stick with the classes you already have - I wouldn't even add a breadth course).

history.content: I'm taking EE 16B, 61C, and a language class. I'm planning on recruiting for new grad jobs this semester. Is this a light course load? Any recommendations for CS courses that would be okay to balance?
history.subject: Should I take another class on top of recruiting?
